etymologies: late 16th century (originally denoting a person who supported a great burden): via Latin from Greek Atlas, the Titan of Greek mythology who supported the heavens and whose picture appeared at the front of early atlases

definitions: a book of maps or charts

examples.text: I looked in the atlas to find a map of Italy

definitions: a book of illustrations or diagrams on any subject
shortDefinitions: book of illustrations or diagrams on any subject

definitions: the topmost vertebra of the backbone, articulating with the occipital bone of the skull.
shortDefinitions: topmost vertebra of backbone, articulating with occipital bone of skull

definitions: a stone carving of a male figure, used as a column to support the entablature of a Greek or Greek-style building.
shortDefinitions: stone carving of male figure, used as column to support entablature of Greek or Greek-style building
